snippet: T. J. Lane, 17, who did not attend Chardon High School, was accused of three counts of aggravated murder.
abstract: Prosecutors formally file murder charges against T J Lane, the teenager accused of methodically killing three students and wounding two others in a shooting rampage at a high school in Chardon, Ohio; charges are filed in juvenile court, but prosecutors say it is likely that Lane, who is 17, will be charged as an adult, facing a maximum sentence of life without parole.

byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise reported from Chardon, and Jennifer Preston from New York. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: T. J. Lane, 17, who did not attend Chardon High School, was accused of three counts of aggravated murder.

headline.main: Teenager Is Charged in Killing of 3 at a School
headline.print_headline: Teenager Is Charged In Killing of 3 At a School
